intro: Hieracium megalodon var. falcatidens, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 50–100 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and somewhat hairy. This variant is notable for its large, robust flowers and its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
